Description:
Objectives: To create commercially, strategically and technically viable conferences and workshops for the company based on market research and space and industry requirements.Key Responsibility Areas (KRAs):Research and Analysis
Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, emerging topics and market demands.
Analyze competitor events and industry benchmarks to gain insights and identify unique selling points for conferences and workshops.
Stay up to date with industry news, regulations and technological advancements relevant to the events industry.Event Conceptualization and StrategyDevelop conference and workshop concepts that align with market trends and meet the company's strategic objectives.
Identify target audience segments and their specific needs and preferences.
Create a compelling value proposition for each event, highlighting its unique selling points and benefits for attendees.Program Development and Content CurationCollaborate with subject matter experts, industry leaders and speakers to develop relevant and impactful event programs.
Curate engaging and informative content that addresses the needs and interests of the target audience.
Ensure a balance of keynote presentations, panel discussions, workshops and networking opportunities to create a comprehensive event experience.Speaker and Delegate Relationship ManagementIdentify potential speakers and delegates who are industry experts or influential figures.
Establish and maintain cordial relationships with speakers and delegates, ensuring their active participation and engagement.
Communicate and coordinate with speakers and delegates to secure their availability and ensure their appearance at the event.Technical Planning and ExecutionWork closely with technical teams and vendors to ensure the technical feasibility and seamless execution of conferences and workshops.
Identify and recommend suitable event venues, taking into consideration technical requirements, space availability and logistical considerations.
Coordinate with audiovisual, lighting and other technical suppliers to ensure the smooth operation of event equipment and technology.
Evaluation and Improvement
Conduct post-event evaluations to assess the success and effectiveness of conferences and workshops.
Analyze attendee feedback, performance metrics and financial results to identify areas for improvement.
Implement lessons learned and make recommendations for future events to enhance the overall event experience.AccountabilitySole accountability and responsibility of all assigned task, proper reporting and communication.Skills
Skills:
Successful Launch of Commercially Viable Events (Based on revenue targets and profitability)
Number of Attendees and Market Penetration
Attendee Satisfaction Ratings and Feedback
Speaker and Delegate Attendance (Percentage of confirmed speakers and delegates who attend)
Sponsorship and Partnership Acquisition
Technical Execution and Quality of Event Production
Budget Adherence and Cost Management
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Feedback
